title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. Amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 increases Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. The maximum grant amount is raised to $5,100, with adjustments based on expected family contribution. Additionally, the grant amount is increased from $400 to $500. Additional funds are authorized and appropriated for implementation. The Higher Education Act of 1965 amendment allocates $4,331,000,000 for the 2007-2008 academic year to increase Federal Pell Grants by $1,050. The amendments take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on deduction for interest on education loans to $3,750 with an increase in phaseout limits to $75,000 ($150,000) for taxable years after 2007. The amendment increases the deduction for interest on education loans to $3,750 with higher phaseout limits for taxable years after 2007. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2006, and the sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to this amendment. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is after December 31, 2006. Repeal of sunset provision for certain tax relief act. The Act does not apply to modifications to education individual retirement accounts. Section 411 of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, regarding employer-provided educational assistance, is exempt from the sunset provisions of the Act.
